meanings.definition: Relating to the electrical activity of living cells.
meanings.sent1: The electrophysiological experiment focused on the cell's electrical activity.
meanings.sent2: Doctors used electrophysiological tests to study the electrical signals in the body.
meanings.sent3: The electrophysiological puzzle of the cell's energy flow was finally solved.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an electrophysiological storm, full of vibrant energy.
meanings.sent5: The electrophysiological dance of ions within the cell was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of electrical signals in the body.
meanings.sent1: Researchers conducted an electrophysiological study on the body's electrical signals.
meanings.sent2: The electrophysiological analysis revealed interesting patterns in the body's signals.
meanings.sent3: The electrophysiological investigation into the body's signals was both fascinating and complex.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts raced like an electrophysiological lightning storm in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The electrophysiological exploration of the body's electrical signals was enlightening.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the measurement of electrical impulses in the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The electrophysiological test accurately measured the nervous system's impulses.
meanings.sent2: Doctors relied on electrophysiological tools to monitor the nervous system's impulses.
meanings.sent3: The electrophysiological examination of the nervous system's impulses was surprisingly fun.
meanings.sent4: His words sparked an electrophysiological reaction in her nervous system.
meanings.sent5: The electrophysiological monitoring of the nervous system's impulses was crucial for diagnosis.
